summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 13204, entitled, "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Thirty-second Avenue South, in the City of Seattle, from Day Street to Massachusetts Street; Day Street, from Thirty-first Avenue South to Thirty-second Avenue South; Thirty-first Avenue South, from Day Street to Judkins Street; Judkins Street, from Thirtieth Avenue South to Thirty-first Avenue South, and Thirtieth Avenue South, from Judkins Street to Norman Street, by constructing concrete sidewalks with necessary curbs, gutters and crosswalks, in accordance with Resolution No. 762 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
